guide.introduction:
Lots of my friends have kids, and that means lots of birthdays. I wanted to have a custom present that’s easy to make and has lots of room to play, in terms of design.

A toy car fits perfectly. So I can build cars and make kids happy? Win-win!
guide.introduction_rendered:
Lots of my friends have kids, and that means lots of birthdays. I wanted to have a custom present that’s easy to make and has lots of room to play, in terms of design.

A toy car fits perfectly. So I can build cars and make kids happy? Win-win!

Relevant parts
  • Plywood
  • Bolts
  • Locknuts
  • Spacers
  • Inline skate wheels with bearings
  • Wood glue
Tools
  • Clamps
  • Cutting templates
  • Drill
  • Laser cutter or jigsaw, router, or coping saw

lines.text: Download the templates and use them to cut the plywood body. Use a laser cutter, or cut with hand or power tools. Sand edges.
lines.text_raw: [http://cdn.makezine.com/make/32/toy_car_templates.zip|Download the templates]  and use them to cut the plywood body. Use a laser cutter, or cut with hand or power tools. Sand edges.

lines.text: The templates are there to give you different car body options. I used piece numbers 1, 3, and 5. I printed a quantity of two #1 pieces, two #3 pieces, and one #5 piece.
lines.text_raw: The templates are there to give you different car body options. I used piece numbers 1, 3, and 5. I printed a quantity of two #1 pieces, two #3 pieces, and one #5 piece.

lines.text: Run each bolt through a wheel, a spacer, the car body, another spacer, another wheel, and a locknut to cap it off. (Remove the wheel's internal spacer if necessary.)
lines.text_raw: Run each bolt through a wheel, a spacer, the car body, another spacer, another wheel, and a locknut to cap it off. (Remove the wheel's internal spacer if necessary.)

lines.text: The car is ready to roll! If you want, change a layer or two, or even redesign the whole thing.
lines.text_raw: The car is ready to roll! If you want, change a layer or two, or even redesign the whole thing.

lines.text: Take the car body apart and apply wood glue between the layers. Reassemble, clamp, and let dry.
lines.text_raw: Take the car body apart and apply wood glue between the layers. Reassemble, clamp, and let dry.

lines.text: You now have a toy car that's ready for tons of abuse. It can go very, very fast. Little kids will have no problem moving it around, and bigger kids will enjoy whipping it off ramps to see how it performs.
lines.text_raw: You now have a toy car that's ready for tons of abuse. It can go very, very fast. Little kids will have no problem moving it around, and bigger kids will enjoy whipping it off ramps to see how it performs.

lines.text: There's lots of room for customization. Make the body profile realistic or more abstract. Give the car a front and back, or make it symmetrical. Play with the wheel size and the distance between the front and back wheels. Stain or paint can liven your car up, as well as extra details such as names or stickers. Make your car what you want it to be!
